column4: what is the way for starting daemons automatically in Ubuntu?
where are the sshd, httpd and other stuff lokated in ubuntu?
i dont remember maybe /etc ? config files?
maybe etc? then how to start them automatically?
in some other distros they are inside /etc/rc.d/
and there is /etc/rc.di can't do it manually with vim?
init.d ok thanks. that's what I needed. what is the config file for init.d?
upstart system v inittab .. don't know any of that. i just want to start sshd and httpd and cron daemons during boot of system
but with ubuntu it's not simple
i was hopping maybe they will start by themselves after installation :) but not sure if that was the case
all of them? cron, sshd, httpd?
and they start after each reboot right?
update-rc.d is it a file? can i edit that in vim?
then I can do #sudo update-rc.d httpd defaults as well right?
